part_5.question_text: According to most economists, it is ____ that insurance claims from recent flooding in the United Kingdom will exceed 2$ billion.
The university researchers will publish the findings of ____ study on energy-saving devices in a scientific journal.
Mr. Godwin seems to be the most ____of all the applicants for the project manager position.
Direct flights from Beijing to Tokyo ____ last for around 3 hours and 30 minutes.
Allocating additional government funds for agricultural programs will decrease the country’s ____ on imports.
Among the team members in the sales department, Ava Patel has ____ herself by securing contracts with three key clients.
All children’s toys from local and foreign manufacturers must be carefully tested ____ they can be put on the market.
The Marigold Hotel is currently undergoing a large-scale renovation, with its re-opening ____ planned for April 6.
Ms. Marcus had always wanted to have her own bakery,____ she started a cupcake store after finishing her studies.
Hotels in Barcelona are expected to see a sharp rise in room reservations ____ the next six months.
Vollmer Airlines’s board approved the extension of the company’s voluntary retirement scheme by ____ three months.
The mutual fund is open to all employees of the Schulz Group ____institutional investors, including insurance companies.
Having spoken Italian for 20 years, Mr. Adessi had difficulty ____ exclusively in English with his international business partners.
Pet Treats has gained ____ from many animal organizations for producing healthy organic food for dogs and cats.
As part of its two-year business plan, fast- food giant Sartin Corporation aims to open one hundred branches ____ Europe.
The user manual explains ____ the microwave oven can be disposed of properly to avoid harming the environment.
After successfully____ with Headlines last year, Curling Room became the largest salon in Singapore.
As recognition for her ____ client retention record, Ms. Wallace received a generous year-end bonus.
Mr. Cooper first won the Salesman of the Year award and ____ surpassed the all-time annual sales record at CarMax.
Evergreen Solutions has expanded strategically into several ____ markets in Southeast Asia such as Vietnam and Indonesia.
____ all Ancient Egypt Travel tours, members can enjoy up to a 10% discount until the end of May.
A partial ceiling collapse occurred in the manufacturing plant ____ which Mr. Wod has worked for the past 15 years.
Because of unusually high ____ for fabric, Metheny Textiles is requiring employees to perform at least five hours of overtime work every week.
____ participating in tomorrow’s fire drill will have to use the stairs, as elevators will be out of service during the activity.
A visa application must be submitted to the Embassy of the United States of America at least six months ____ the scheduled travel date.
While many critics were greatly impressed with llumina 893’s features, Samara Woods had a ____ different opinion of the new smartphone.
Before you distribute the report, ask Ms. Burns to check that _____ has all the necessary information.
If Piroid Technologies had not removed its computers from the market, it ____  some less popular features.
Assembly President Doyle Jones warned of the ____ of passing a bailout bill, which may exhaust government funds.
Workers must ____ with safety regulations inside the factory to avoid accidents that may cause serious injuries.

part_6.paragraph: To: Grace Cameron (camerong@interpost.net)From: Sutton Grand Hall (tickets@suttongrand.com)Date: September 7Subject: Ticketing issueDear Ms. Cameron,We would like to inform you of a problem related to tickets you purchased for our autumn ---131--- series. Our records show that you are a ticketholder for the Lara Azevedo performance. Unfortunately, the singer has fallen ill and will ---132--- be unable to make an appearance.We apologize for any inconvenience caused by this cancellation. As this show was part of the seasonal tickets you bought, we have devised a plan for compensation. The venue is giving patrons in your situation ---133--- options. First, you may choose to receive a voucher for an upcoming event at Sutton Grand Hall. Alternatively, you may request a partial cash refund in the amount of $35. ---134---. Sincerely,Thomas RowellBox Office Manager, Sutton Grand Hall

answers: (A) Please let us know your preference between these choices.
(B) We hope you will purchase seasonal tickets again in the future.
(C) We wish Ms. Azevedo all the best as she continues to recover.
(D) Please visit us in person to discuss the various options available.
questions.correct_answer: (A) Please let us know your preference between these choices.

Rest assured that these are not available elsewhere. ---137---.We are confident that you will find the time you spend at Hillglen Country Club ---138---.We look forward to welcoming you in the near future.Sincerely,Rachel GossDirector of Member Services, Hillglen Country Club

part_6.paragraph: Eats and Treats MagazineWeekly Restaurant ReviewThe Rosewood, 155 Firth Street, BristolTel: 555-8823By Farah YatesBristol is not normally associated with fine dining, but The Rosewood, owned by successful restaurateur Gordon Rattray, ---139--- style and class to this quiet town’s dining scene.As soon as you enter the restaurant, you will notice the dining area’s unique atmosphere. ---140---. In fact, the restaurant is ---141--- elegant that it has already been used for several wedding receptions and formal banquets.I was impressed with the restaurant’s garden salad and succulent Duck à I’orange, which were both expertly prepared by head chef Jean Dugardin. ---142---, the menu offers a mouth-watering selection of flavorful pastas, grilled steaks, seafood dishes, and decadent desserts.Although the service was a little slow, I would still recommend The Rosewood based on its food and dining experience. Overall rating: 4/5 stars

(D) It is conveniently located in the city’s most popular neighborhood.
questions.correct_answer: (A) And, you also can’t miss the luxuriously decorated interior.

You may check into your rooms anytime after 2 P.M., and the checkout time for August 9 is noon. Your confirmation code is 4529534. part_7.paragraph:
URGENT 
Memo: To All BigMart Employees
From: Technical Support
An outside entity has been foot printing our computer system.
BigMart security procedures have been explored, ARE COMPROMISED, and should be considered non¬functional. Within the hour, specialized tech consultants will be completing their penetration testing to determine vulnerabilities and security holes. Until further notice, do not use the Internet under ANY conditions. This will be resolved before noon today. You will be immediately notified upon resolution.

(D) Someone has hacked into the computer system.
questions.correct_answer: (D) Someone has hacked into the computer system.

(D) Not use the Internet until further notice

part_7.paragraph:
Dennis [11:05 A.M.]
Hi, Andrea! I’m so confused.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Andrea [11:06A.M.]
What’s wrong, Dennis?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Dennis [11:08 A.M.]
My assistant called me a few minutes ago. The buyers from Texas will be in town on the 16th, but I thought we were going to be closed that day.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Andrea [11:09 A.M.]
You’re right! We’re supposed to get the office renovated and the old plumbing replaced. Perhaps we could change it. I don’t think replacing the plumbing is an urgent matter.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Dennis [11:10 A.M.]
I think you’re right. The Texas clients are the biggest account. I’ll talk to the manager right away.

questions.question_text: What will happen on the 16th?

(C) A trade fair will be held.

answers: (A) The office closure date should be rescheduled.

(C) She has another appointment on the 16th.
(D) She suggests changing the flight time.
questions.correct_answer: (A) The office closure date should be rescheduled.

part_7.paragraph: The US military market is the world’s fifth largest network. This lucrative outlet offers reliable products to a population with high income levels. With the right product positioning, brand recognition and customer loyalty will continue well beyond the period of military service.Access to this powerful sales outlet does not follow conventional marketing paths. Procurement and distribution are highly structured and military expectations of vendor and after-sales support far exceed those of the typical retailer. In order to maximize this market, you need to rely on specialists who have the experience to make it happen for you.That’s where we come in: Malveo Associates. Since 1985, we have worked exclusively with the military. Our track record is one of the best in the industry. We know what sells in the military and we know how to sell it.

questions.question_text: What is Malveo Associates?
answers: (A) An advertising agency promoting the US military
(B) A manufacturers' representative for military retail products
(C) A designer of military procurement policy
questions.correct_answer: (B) A manufacturers' representative for military retail products

questions.question_text: What is NOT stated about military retail?
answers: (A) Malveo Associates has been in service for over 20 years.
(D) Expectations of after-sales support are high.

part_7.paragraph:
refer to the following job posting.First Vision Bank Posting Date: May 21Position Type: Branch ManagerContact:  First Vision Bank WebsiteLocation: Tampa, FL, USAEmployer
First Vision Bank is one of the largest banks on the east coast with 1,425 branches in 11 states and employs over 25,000 people. In Florida alone, there are 470 branches. On March 11th, First Vision Bank was named the best employer in the Southeastern Region by the Sunshine Times of South Florida. We provide a competitive salary and benefits, and excellent opportunities for career growth.Responsibilities and Requirements
Duties will include managing and evaluating branch staff. Also responsible for efficient and effective consumer banking sales, service, and relationship management of our customers. The successful candidate will possess excellent organizational and communication skills and a strong knowledge of bank products and services. Previous managerial experience desired.
To be considered for this position, interested individuals must apply online at www.firstvisionbank.com by July 31. Interviews will be conducted the week of August 20th.

part_7.paragraph: To: Manu Emanuel (M.Emanuel@Westwood.com)From: Christopher Eggers (C.Eggers@Westwood.com)Date: March 03Re: Language FeatureDear Manu,After viewing your webpage, I would like to ask you about the programming codes you used for the company’s German website for your customers. I noticed that the customers could view the webpage in a number of different languages and a feature which would be ideal for our customer base. I would like to employ this function and make it available for our Belgian customers. Would it be possible to send me the codes and tell me how to design this function? Then I can simply alter these language options for our targeted market to include Belgian, Norwegian, and Swedish consumers.I hope to see you when I attend the managerial workshops in Berlin next week. It is my first visit to Germany so I am looking forward to it. Perhaps we can meet up while I’m there in case I have any additional questions regarding the program.Thank you for your time.Christopher Eggers

part_7.paragraph:
Antarctica, one of the most breathtakingly beautiful places on the planet! You can be there in all the luxury of Explore Cruises' fabulous food, elegant state rooms, and on-board activities. We also offer daily lectures on the continent's wildlife and geology. A cruise ship is the best way to see Antarctica because most of the wildlife is found in dangerous spots. How would you like to see penguins, seals, and whales playing in water beneath gigantic icebergs? Or sight whales and albatross following the ship? The tourist season is only from November through February because the rest of the year is too cold, icy, and dark for travel. In December, you'll see hatching penguins and baby chicks.
In February, fledging chicks waddle on shore. The 10-day adventure begins at Tierra del Fuego, Argentina, where you'll board ship. On 4 of the 10 days, you'll take land excursions. If conditions are right, you'll be swimming in hot springs on one of these stops. This is the trip of a lifetime!
For more information, go to explorecruises.com

questions.question_text: What is NOT mentioned as an on-board benefit?
Why is a cruise the best way to see Antarctica?
answers: (A) It’s too cold to get off the ship.
(C) There’s no other way to get there.
(D) Animals are not afraid of ships.

questions.question_text: When is the tourist season?

part_7.paragraph:
Mr. Fellows,
I appreciate the information you sent about your participation in the Las Vegas Sports Show. It sounds like your display will be one of the most exciting ones there. I look forward to going through it and, especially, meeting the lineup of basketball stars in attendance. My itinerary, thus far, has the following openings for a time that you and I can get together to discuss your quantity capabilities and pricing.
Monday the 12th: between I 1:00 and 3:30 (How about lunch?)
Tuesday the 13th: all morning until noon
Wednesday the 14th: any time after 2:00 RM.
Thursday the 15th: any time, all day, before 6:00 P.M. when I leave for the airport
If your schedule does not permit a meeting during any of these available times in my schedule, just let me know. I can postpone other appointments to assure a meeting with you. I hope we can also manage some social time. You were a wizard at the blackjack table at last year’s show!
Sincerely,
George Macmillan

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of this letter?
answers: (B) To remind Mr. Fellows that he already knows Mr. Macmillan
(D) To arrange a time for a meeting that is mutually agreeable
questions.correct_answer: (D) To arrange a time for a meeting that is mutually agreeable

questions.question_text: What is inferred about Mr. Fellows’ company?
answers: (A) It is headquartered in Las Vegas.

questions.question_text: What is inferred about Mr. Macmillan?
answers: (A) He sells large quantities of sports equipment.
(B) He is available on Wednesday morning.
(C) He participated in the Sports Show last year.
questions.correct_answer: (C) He participated in the Sports Show last year.

part_7.paragraph:
David Tylor [9:39 A.M.]
Hi, all! Did you get the new employ handbook? This manual provides information on company policies ranging from employee guidelines, benefits, to health and safety issues.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Mia Chen [9:40 A.M.]
Good morning! Yes, I would just like to say the new employee handbook is amazing.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Alex Lo [9:42 A.M.]
I couldn’t agree more. I thought it was just going to be a manual that has an introduction to the company, and some boring policies that were already listed in the previous books. Boy, I was wrong.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Mia Chen [9:43 A.M.]
Right! I never thought an employee handbook can be this fun to read with a load of information about the company and procedures.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Alex Lo [9:45 A.M.]
What I like most is how you put everything into color pictures and what we must do in emergency situations is much easier to read than ever. I never knew that we had to exit by stairs in a fire hazard.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Mia Chen [9:46 A.M.]
I feel 1 have more knowledge about the company, and I am willing to work harder to do better for the company.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------David Tylor [9:47 A.M.]
I’m glad that you guys like it. Other full-time employees in non- administrative positions, as well as part-time staff, should have received their handbooks through the mail. If you have not yet received a copy, you should contact your supervisor immediately.

questions.question_text: At 9:42 A.M., what does Alex Lo mean when he writes, “Boy, I was wrong”?
answers: (A) It is somewhat difficult for new hires to understand the employee handbook.
(B) The employee handbook is a manual that has an introduction to the company, and boring policies.
(C) The employee handbook has various information which is easy to read and simple.
(D) The employee handbook has same policies written from the previous one.
questions.correct_answer: (C) The employee handbook has various information which is easy to read and simple.

questions.question_text: How were manuals distributed to part-time employees?
What should employees do if they have not obtained this year’s manual?
answers: (A) Continue to use the earlier copy

part_7.paragraph: A company succeeds when work is effectively organized and when people work well together. In an authoritative organization , orders are passed down from the top.Obedience is maintained through the fear of losing employment or the hope of promotion. —[1] — . However, work makes rapid progress. In a participatory organization, people accept responsibility for the work required of them. —[2]—. The manager’s job, in this case , is to support and encourage workers while removing obstacles to maximum performance. —[3]—.The degree to which a manager should be authoritative or supportive is different for different kinds of organizations. It is also different for different tasks within an organization. —[4]—.

questions.question_text: What is this article about?
What is a benefit of an authoritative organization?
What is stated about a participatory organization?

In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?"A good manager is always aware of how much authority and how much support will lead to the desired results."

part_7.paragraph:
"Teen Who Makes a Difference” Award
Children of America, Inc.
112 Brett Drive
Kalamazoo, Michigan 33002
Dear Award Committee:
I would like to nominate Abby Martin for this year’s “Teen Who Makes a Difference” award. — [1] —. She’s a senior at Fledgefield High in Milledgeville, Arizona. As a sophomore, she raised money to feed hungry children by encouraging classmates to help her. She then started a web site, kidscare.com., with links to sites of similar interest. — [2] —. Children interested in raising money in their schools e-mail Abby with their names and addresses. She sends them kits with everything they need for a fund drive in their school. When site visitors want to make direct online donations to alleviate world hunger, kidscare.com has a list of links to reputable organizations. So far, close to three million dollars has been raised by teenagers and children using the kits and by site visitors. — [3] —. It’s amazing what a difference this 17-year-old has already made! — [4] —.
Sincerely,
Sarah Brandt
Fledgefield High teacher

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the letter?
answers: (A) To nominate a student for an award
(B) To raise money for world hunger
(C) To encourage links to a website
(D) To raise money for Kids Care
questions.correct_answer: (A) To nominate a student for an award

questions.question_text: The word “cool” in paragraph 1, line 11, is closest in meaning to:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?  “One reason the site gets so many hits is that Abby makes really cool videos about world hunger.”
Which is NOT stated about Abby Martin?
answers: (D) She believes adults can solve problems.
questions.correct_answer: (D) She believes adults can solve problems.

part_7.paragraph:
To: Edward Diamond
345 Palace View, Apt. 6A
Winterbottom TX C67 LM7
Account No.: 5789-23-4376
Notice: Estimated Bill
We couldn’t read your energy meters for the last three months because we have been unable to access your residence. As a result, we have no choice but to bill you for an estimated figure using previous months’ usage.
However, estimations can result in incorrect billing. It may be the case that we overestimate your usage and you will be charged more than you actually use. If we underestimate your usage, you could receive a larger bill after we read the actual amount.
We suggest that you take a reading of your own meter and submit it in order to prevent another estimated billing. Details of how to read your meter are enclosed with this letter and are very explanatory. Once you obtain an actual reading, it can be submitted to our automated telephone system by calling at 555-4376-5498 on your scheduled reading date.
Alternatively, if you wish to have your meter read by a BE employee, you can schedule a specific time which is convenient for you by calling 555-4376-3244 before August 8th.
Tony Starks
Customer Relations Manager
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------BE Corporation
Monthly Statement - July
Account No: 5789-23-4376
Service to: Edward Diamond
345 Palace View, Apt. 6A
Winterbottom, TX C67 LM7Account Summary
Balance from last bill: $45.67
Payment received July 5 - Thank you!: $45.67
Current monthly charges: $20.05
Amount Due on August 12th : $20.05Billing Details
Total Kilowatt-hours(kwh)used in 30 days 215*
* : estimated
Basic service charge: $6.05
Supply
Energy 215kwh@0.100000: $21.50
Total Electric Charges: $27.55
Next Meter Reading Date: August 19

answers: (A) To request information from Mr. Diamond
(B) To inform Mr. Diamond of a billing error
(C) To offer a new service plan
questions.correct_answer: (A) To request information from Mr. Diamond

questions.question_text: When is Mr. Diamond advised to call the automated system?
In the notice, the word “submit” in paragraph 3, in line 1, is closest in meaning to:
According to the bill, what is included in the current monthly charge?

part_7.paragraph:
EMPLOYMENT PLACEMENT SERVICES 
115 5th St. Anchorage, AK 99508July 8
Mr. Khalil Leroy
Anchorage, AK 99508
Dear Mr. Leroy:
We are pleased to offer you a fee of $3,500 for your assistance in recruiting high school business students to act as guides during our school-to-work job fair this summer. We have appreciated your assistance in the past, and looking forward to working with you again this year.
The job fair will begin on the evening of July 28 and will continue through August 2nd. Though past fairs have been held in the conference halls here at our site, the size of this year’s fair requires the use of a larger facility. Students will need to report to the Eagle Convention Center on the morning of July 28.
Zack Blanton will be contacting you with more information, and any questions you may have should be directed to him.
Again, thank you very much.
Sincerely,
Albert Ross Donalson
Director, EPS-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To: Mr Albert Ross Donalson
From: Khalil Leroy
Hey, Mr. Donalson, it was a great pleasure working with you last summer in the student work fair, and I would love to work with you again this summer. And my goodness, $3,500? I really am thankful for this, I’m not even sure I deserve such a big check for my work. The time for this year workshop sounds good to me. I was starting to wonder what I am going to do for the rest of the summer vacation, but it seems to me that you give me another nice, fun job to do. I will see you on July 28th at the Eagle Convention center. Until then, stay safe!
Sincerely,
Khalil Leroy

questions.question_text: Why did Mr. Donalson contacted Leroy?
answers: (A) To give him an opportunity to work
questions.correct_answer: (A) To give him an opportunity to work

questions.question_text: Where will the job fair take place?
Who would most likely call Leroy soon?
Who is Khalil Leroy?
answers: (B) Owner of the Eagle Convention Center
(C) A student that helped Albert Ross

questions.question_text: When are the students supposed to report to the Eagle Convention Center?

part_7.paragraph:
From: Hank Morris (hmorris@foodworld.com)
To: Vanessa Williams (vwilliams@foodworld.com)
Date: October 8
Re: E.coli outbreak
Vanessa,
We need to respond immediately to information from the Food and Drug Administration about an E.coli outbreak in cabbage. A televised press conference is scheduled for this afternoon at 4:00 p.m., after which it will be in all the news media. As CEO, I’ll be in charge of this matter. Also, we must do everything to protect Food World shoppers and make them feel confident shopping for produce in our stores. I would like you to write an urgent text message as well as e-mail. You cannot overstate the importance of doing this! Please send me a copy of your text message before disseminating it to our stores. Thank you.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: Vanessa Williams  <vwilliams@foodworld.com>
To: Hank Morris  <hmorris@foodworld.com>
Date: October 8
Re: E.coli outbreak
Hank,
I’ve attached, for your review, my e-mail. As a senior manager, I also suggest that Food World executives meet today to discuss how to deal with customers’ fears about purchasing fresh produce. A bacteriologist, specializing in large-scale farming, has agreed to be available for the meeting, at any time this afternoon. At the meeting, I would like to propose developing a brochure directed to customers. It should address what E.coli is, how it affects people, how fields are tested for bacteria, the reliability of these tests, and consumer safe handling of fresh fruits and vegetables.The brochure should be available as soon as possible after press coverage of the outbreak.
This brochure should help our customers understand that their safety is our priority and that they can feel comfortable buying Food World produce. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From : Vanessa Williams
Received : October 8, 2:28 P.M.
To : All store managers
Any fresh leafy vegetable and fruits processed after Sept. 30 should be immediately removed from shelves. No vegetables processed after Sept. 30 should be restocked until further notice. Managers, yourselves, should do the actual product removal. After removal is completed, store managers should e-mail a confirmation to me. Thank you.

questions.question_text: What does Mr. Morris ask Ms. Williams to do?
answers: (B) Find an E.coli specialist to speak to staff

questions.question_text: Who is Vanessa Williams?
What product is not to be removed from the store?
What does Ms. Williams NOT want to discuss in the meeting?
answers: (C) Making customers trust Food World for food safety

questions.question_text: What is Ms. Williams' attachment?
answers: (B) A scheduled time for an executive meeting
(D) A list of all Food World stores

part_7.paragraph:
Het Overzicht HotelAmsterdam, JR Netherlands
31-20-5555555At Het Overzicht, we assure successful conventions through effective and thorough planning. Preparation for any meeting takes much more than just having the right amount of space or A/V equipment. Our personal planners dig deeper, with pre-event communications regarding objective and scope of meetings as well as corporate personality. We will stop at nothing to make everything JUST RIGHT for you and your staff.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To: Hans Strayhorn, General manager
From: Bill McKenzie, Vice President
Date: March 20th
Subject: New Service
We hope your conference at the Het Overzicht accomplished everything you planned for, and more. Situated by the most beautiful garden in Holland, we also hope you took time to enjoy the magnificent view. The Het Overzicht has become one of the world’s most popular convention sites and we intend to keep it that way. Because this is a relatively new service provided by Het Overzicht, we’d especially like to know if your personal planner was useful to you. Please help us continue this commitment by taking a few moments to let us know about your visit. Just log in at hetoverzicht.com and fill out the form onsite, fax it, or mail it.
Sincerely,
Hans Strayhorn
General Manager
Het Overzicht---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------https://www.hetoverzicht.com /guest_comments
* Name: Bill McKenzie* Address: Alpha Dish Networks 1260 Cranberry Square Lincoln, Massachusetts 11650* Comments: Our convention was very successful, in no small part, due to the efforts of the Het Overzicht. You will see, in the form I completed online, that I gave your hotel an “excellent” in response to almost every question. However, Alpha Dish Networks has an experienced event planner on staff. The efforts of your planner, in addition to our own, took more time than needed.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the e-mail?
In the advertisement, the word “dig” in line 3, is closest in meaning to:
What did Mr. McKenzie like about the Het Overzicht?
answers: (D) Everything, except the personal planner was not useful
questions.correct_answer: (D) Everything, except the personal planner was not useful

questions.question_text: What does the personal planner NOT analyze before events?
Which of the following is true?
answers: (A) Mr. McKenzie is a hotel manager.
(B) The two companies are in different countries.
(D) A survey is conducted by phone.
questions.correct_answer: (B) The two companies are in different countries.

part_7.paragraph:
To: All TechCom employees
From: Raymond Carter, Director of Human Resources
We understand that your productivity relies, in part, on how comfortable you are about your child’s welfare while you are at work. TechCom is pleased to announce an on-site daycare center, opening in July. Although we will be subsidizing the operating costs of the center, there will still be a small fee expected from parents.
TechCom’s childcare will be managed by Sylvia Johnston, who is a certified teacher and has a Ph.D. in Early Childhood Development. Ms. Johnston has taught third grade for 6 years, after which she successfully managed Play House Daycare for 7 years. There is a large grassy area between TechCom’s building and the south parking lot which will be fenced in and installed with playground equipment. Indoors, children will have an array of toys and games: building blocks, books, board games, art supplies, work benches and much more. In addition, we will be offering special activities. Refer to the attached schedule for times and costs. As well as full-day care, we will offer after-school care with certified teachers available to help with homework.
TechCom is very pleased to offer this special benefit to our employees and their families.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------TECHCOM DAYCARE 
Open: 8:00 A.M. - 9:00 P.M. Monday through Friday  Cost per child Full-day program 8:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. $80/week.After-school program 3:00 P.M. - 6:00 P.M. $30/week.Extended hours for full-day or after-school programs
			6:00 P.M. - 9:00 P.M. $6/hour.
			8:00 A.M. - 9:00 P.M. drop-ins $6/hour. Additional Activities Tumbling and Gymnastics
			6 weeks (1 hour/2 times a week, on-site, $120)Early Music or Intermediate Music
			4 weeks (1 hour/2 times a week, on-site, $80)Swimming Lessons
			Children are walked 1 block to the YMCA pool
			4 weeks (1 hour/2 times a week $100)Basketball Training
			Children are walked 1 block to the YMCA gym
			4 weeks (1 hour/2 times a week $100)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Notice Posted July 28
Due to the lack of children, Music class has been canceled. Tuition is discounted for families enrolling multiple children. If you have suggestions, comments, or seek more information, email at raymondcarter@techcom.com. Activity brochures are available on request. A luncheon for interested parents will be catered, June 5, at the daycare site. This will be your opportunity to meet the daycare director.

questions.question_text: What would be the monthly cost of one child in daycare from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M.?
Why is TechCom offering on-site daycare?
answers: (C) Good daycare is hard to find.
(D) Techcom wants to test its products on children.

questions.question_text: What does the daycare director NOT bring to her job?
What activity will take place on-site?
How do parents get more information?
